alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:05PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henrico and south central Hanover Counties and the City of Richmond through 145 PM EDT... At 105 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Highland Springs, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Highland Springs around 120 PM EDT. Mechanicsville around 130 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Richmond International, Fair Oaks, Montrose, Sandston and Chamberlayne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond)
